mlr3torch 0.0.0.9000

  • Changelog

    Torch Entry Point for Categorical Features

    mlr_pipeops_torch_ingress_categ.Rd

    Ingress PipeOp that represents a categorical (factor(), ordered() and logical()) entry point to a torch network.

    Format

    R6Class inheriting from PipeOpTorchIngress/PipeOpTorch.

    Construction

    PipeOpTorchIngressCategorical$new(id = "torch_ingress_categ", param_vals = list())

    • id :: character(1)
      The id for the object.

    • param_vals :: named list()
      List of hyperparameter settings to overwrite the initial values. Default is list().

    Input and Output Channels

    One input channel called "input" and one output channel called"output". For an explanation see PipeOpTorch.

    State

    The state is the value calculated by the public method shapes_out().

    Parameters

    • select :: logical(1)
      Whether PipeOp should selected the supported feature types. Otherwise it will err on receiving tasks with unsupported feature types.

    Fields

    Only fields inherited from PipeOpTorchIngress / PipeOp.

    Methods

    Only methods inherited from PipeOpTorchIngress / PipeOp.

    Internals

    Uses batchgetter_categ().

    See also

    Other PipeOps: mlr_pipeops_torch_ingress_numeric

    Examples

    po_ingress = po("torch_ingress_categ", select = TRUE)
task = tsk("german_credit")
# The output is a TorchIngressToken
token = po_ingress$train(list(task))[[1L]]
ingress = token$ingress[[1L]]
ingress$batchgetter(task$data(1, ingress$features), "cpu")
#> Error in cpp_torch_int64(): Lantern is not loaded. Please use `install_torch()` to install additional dependencies.
